reporting-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

title.narrative: DICTORNA "Family medicine" negli stati di Red Sea, Kassala e di Khartoum

description.narrative: L'obiettivo del progetto è quello di contribuire a migliorare la salute della popolazione nei tre stati del Mar Rosso, Kassala e Khartoum, attraverso il rafforzamento dell'efficienza dei servizi sanitari nazionali e in particolare migliorando le capacità funzionali e operative dell’Assistenza sanitaria primaria. Il programma si concentra sulla creazione della Medicina Familiare e il sostegno al National Health Insurance System, chiamato a svolgere un ruolo cruciale nell'ambizioso programma governativo di espansione della copertura sanitaria a tutta la popolazione sudanese (Universal Health Coverage)

The planning goal of the project is to contribute to improving the health of the population in the three states of Red Sea , Kassala and Khartoum, through the strengthening of the National Health Services efficiency, and in particular by improving the functional and operational capabilities of the Primary Health Care. The program is focusing on the establishment of the Family Medicine and the support to the National Health Insurance System, called to play a crucial role, in the ambitious governmental program of expanding health coverage to all The Sudanese population (Universal Health Coverage). As far as the Family Medicine Institute is concerned, it will have to be created and integrated at the Health Care Center and precisely at the health center called "Family Health Center". "Family Medicine" is the fundamental point of access of the population to the services provided by the Sudanese Health System. The project will be implemented in the Red Sea, Kassala and Khartoum states. And specifically in the localities of: Port Sudan and Swakin (Red Sea State), Girba and Kassala City (State of Kassala) Jambal Awlya and Bahry in Khartoum (State of Khratoum).

organisation.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

tag.narrative: By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births
By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births
Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
